skill.name: skill-builder
skill.description: Create new Claude Code Skills with proper YAML frontmatter, progressive disclosure structure, and complete directory organization. Use when you need to build custom skills for specific workflows, generate skill templates, or understand the Claude Skills specification.
skill.summary: Create production-ready Claude Code Skills with proper YAML frontmatter, progressive disclosure architecture, and complete file/folder structure.
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: Evaluated 244 static findings. All flagged patterns are false positives: C2 keywords (invalid line numbers), weak crypto (YAML text misidentified), external commands (legitimate bash docs), hardcoded URLs (documentation links), and filesystem access (standard skill paths). This is a legitimate skill-building tool with no malicious code. Safe to publish.

content.value_statement: Creating Claude Code Skills manually is error-prone and time-consuming. This skill generates production-ready skill templates with proper YAML frontmatter, progressive disclosure structure, and complete directory organization so you can focus on functionality.
actual_capabilities: Creates Claude Code Skills with proper YAML frontmatter format
Generates complete directory structure including scripts, resources, and docs folders
Implements progressive disclosure architecture with 4-level content structure
Provides validated skill templates for basic, intermediate, and advanced skills
Documents skill locations and version control best practices
limitations: Does not execute code or install skills automatically
Does not validate existing skills in the marketplace
Does not provide skill testing or deployment automation
Does not generate skill icon graphics or branding assets

best_practices: Include both what the skill does AND when to use it in the description field for autonomous matching
Keep the core SKILL.md file lean (2-5KB) and move detailed content to separate files
Use the 4-level progressive disclosure structure to scale skills without context overhead
Place skills directly in ~/.claude/skills/ or .claude/skills/ without nested subdirectories
anti_patterns: Adding extra fields like version or author to YAML frontmatter (they are ignored by Claude)
Creating deeply nested subdirectories instead of flat skill structure
Burying trigger conditions in the middle of the description instead of front-loading them
Including all documentation inline instead of referencing separate files

faq.question: Where should I place my skill files?
faq.answer: Personal skills go in ~/.claude/skills/[skill-name]/ (available across all projects). Project skills go in .claude/skills/[skill-name]/ in your project root (version controlled).

faq.question: What fields are required in YAML frontmatter?
faq.answer: Only name (max 64 chars) and description (max 1024 chars). The description must include what the skill does and when to use it.

faq.question: What is progressive disclosure?
faq.answer: A 3-level architecture: Level 1 loads always (name + description), Level 2 loads when skill triggers, Level 3+ loads on demand. This lets Claude scale to 100+ skills with minimal context.

faq.question: Can I include executable scripts?
faq.answer: Yes. Place scripts in a scripts/ directory within your skill. Reference them from SKILL.md using markdown code blocks with shell commands.

faq.question: How big should my SKILL.md be?
faq.answer: Keep the main file between 2-5KB. Move extensive documentation, API references, and examples to separate files in docs/ or resources/ and reference them from SKILL.md.

faq.question: What directory structure is supported?
faq.answer: Claude Code requires skills directly under ~/.claude/skills/ or .claude/skills/ without nested subdirectories. Use flat structure with optional scripts/, resources/, and docs/ subdirectories.
